Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Budget Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: kwtravel123
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed there with my family and we had 2 rooms. There was a bit of a problem with the stairs having to go up and down to get to the other room but it wasn't an inconvenience. The rooms are very basic but clean. Ours had a very small kitchenette with a microwave and fry pan. We wouldn't have ever used the electric fry pan but the microwave came in handy. The location is great if you are wanting to be near Kings Cross which is a about a 3 minute walk. There are plenty of cheap eats situated down the side streets. The hotel offers a nice buffet style breakfast. In the lobby there are several computers if you need the internet. One of the downsides is that they don't have any parking. We were told that we would have to pay around $40 per day in a car park which was not nearby and with children we didn't want to park too far away, so we had to keep moving the car on a regular basis, so as we didn't get a parking ticket. Also the rooms which overlook the harbour are not as noisy as the one we stayed in which overlooks the side street, all night long there were gangs of young people mulling around with their hotted up cars making noise.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff but poor hotel”
Reviews.Author: JohnZ05
Reviews.Content: DeVere hotel often appears as one of the cheapeast hotels (around 90 - 100 AUD) when you search for hotels on Expedia or booking and there is little wonder why. It is definitely in poor condition. First the location is OK, not so good as it is quite far from the town center but on a decent quiet location in Potts Point, a bit further from the bustle of the terrible Darlinghurst road. But the hotel itself is old and has not been refurbished for a long time. There are stairs all over the place (and even within a single floor), which is quite incovenient if you have heavy luggage. The rooms are in poor condition (and I was in a superior room), especially the smelly bathrooms, but are relatively clean. Some amenities though, like a safe if I remember well, a desk and some good storage spaces. On the good side, the lobby was in decent condition, the staff was very friendly and there were 2 new computers in the lobby that you could use for 4 AUD an hour. Thus, a relatively poor experience but not so bad given the price. I think that 2 and a half star would be better.

Reviews.Title: “Ever met nicer staff?”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan w
Reviews.Content: This is my first review of a hotel ever,yes,I Jonathan Wookey,having been on this planet for 40 years am writing my first review about a Devere hotel.The people were lovely,charming,in a very simplistic way.Ever been to a Harvester in the UK and hear them ask "have you ever been to a Harvester before?"You think to yourself,"this is just a restaurant,do I need to have been?"Well,upon arriving at this most beautiful Devere hotel,a bell boy ran out to greet me to ask "Jonathan Wookey,Devere hotel nice place hey man"?Certainly a casual approach by one of the Aboriginal staff they had on hand.I am assuming it was tantamount to asking whether I had been before so I answered "no" to which he replied "Jonathan Wookey Devere want to welcome you,what can we do to improve."After this farcical lingo- wrangling,I can honestly say that I have never been treated better and more kindly by any staff in the world who literally wanted for nothing more than to put a smile on my face.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient hotel and a pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: JauntingBrisbane
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a very pleasant experience. The room was clean and tidy with a good bathroom and small kitchette. Someone else had booked the room and so I was unsure what to expect at Kings Cross. It was in a fantastic location (not far past the fountain) and 5 minutes to Kings Cross Train Station. Quiet and very reasonable. I enjoyed my stay and would recommend this hotel to anyone. Lift did smell a bit from the old drains (probably) under the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clueless staff”
Reviews.Author: CNJ40
Reviews.Content: Old building, small rooms, small window that you can't open. The staff are very young and vague and unknowledgeable. Very hard to get accurate information about anything. The shuttle bus to the airport was also run down and 40 min late.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed 3 times over some years...good for price”
Reviews.Author: Denyse T
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed for 3 nights here for the second time last November (2011) before leaving for a long holiday house sitting in the UK. Also stayed November 2010 for 2 nights. The hotel is tired in many ways but the staff are friendly and helpful, the breakfast is always fantastic and for the price (compared to other Sydney prices) there is definite value for money. On both stays we slept well, in 2010 hot water was an issue in the shower but not in 2011. The location is great for a cosmopolitan mix, wonderful Indian food across the road and a Woolworths store just down from the hotel for convenience. We will continue to use the DeVere when in Sydney (unless we win Lotto and can afford Hilton prices!!).

Reviews.Title: “"OK", nothing more than "ok"”
Reviews.Author: da8iwr
Reviews.Content: The area around te corner is a red light district, it's not too in your face or sleezy, nothing like Amsterdam! If anything it was quite funny some of the sights. I was put there by a company I was working for, who didnt know about it's location. The breakfast was ok, full English buffet, cereal, fruit. But it is all the cheapest you can get, very fatty bacon, the eggs I didn't dare try, and the milk is just in the 4pint bottle direct from the shop sat in a bucket of ice lol I think it is Chinese owned, as every member of staff was Chinese, to be honest they were great. The room I had was 313, it was great, good view and at the end of the landing so quieter. Try and get the back room, floor 3 and above for the view. The shower is terrible, litterally a dribble, but my room was big, good size, clean and their is a laundry upstairs that's $4 to wash and $4 to dry. In all I think there are better places, but the area has good (none sleazy respectable) bars, good cheap food at the kings cross hotel, a large woolworths supermarket opposite and a train station 2 mins walk away. Use google street view to see the area ;)

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Sydney if you're sick of hostels.”
Reviews.Author: Robert B
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a pretty good jump off location for Sydney. Considering the price of most hotels in Australia this one was a great value. It's not the most quietest of locations, but it is a 5 minute walk from the subway and there are restaurants everywhere. There are a lot of bars around the corner so it may seem dangerous to some, but really it's better becuase the area is bustling at all hours of the day. If you started up north in Australia and worked your way down like us, then you may be sick of hostels by now! Boom. here ya go.

Reviews.Title: “disturbance of the peace night time from the main street”
Reviews.Author: claudineBangkok
Reviews.Content: We booked 4 nights there. Hotel facilities were ok but the situation has become unbearable due to the noise coming from the main street night time. Indeed, this hotel is situated at the end of "the red-lights district". It's a nice place day and evening time but, almost every night, around 11pm, started a procession of cars: horn, sharp accelerations, full brakes, shouting between people, sound of broken bottles,.... Closing windows didn't change anything because they're not double glazing... The hotel has also rooms in the back, with nice view ... but they're much more expensive... Then if you can afford the price, this hotel is OK, otherwise,....

Reviews.Title: “Good price - great location”
Reviews.Author: Barbara R
Reviews.Content: This is a modest, old hotel, not fancy, but for the location, the price is excellent. It is clean and adequate and service was consistently good. We would not hesitate to recommend it. My husband and I stayed here twice - four nights on our arrival in Sydney and two more at our departure. For the first stay we were at the rear of the hotel in a large, kitchenette room which had a window facing on a small, tree-lined side street - a very good room. One block away is a good sized Woolworth's grocery store, which also sells wine and beer. My husband and I are a retired couple, who like to walk; the Botanical Gardens, Opera House, and Harbor sights are all within walking distance of this hotel. On our return, we opted for a less expensive,non-kitchen room, twin double - as we anticipated eating out. This room was in the interior of the hotel, with no window to the outside and though adequate for a night's sleep, was very small. In hindsight, would have taken the larger room for both stays. The service was consistently good. Staff are always present, professional, and helpful. Apparently they are upgrading some rooms to include WiFi, but we had to use their computers (they have two) in the lobby. Some customers have mentioned the proximity to the red light district. It begins about three or four blocks from the hotel, but does not spill over into the hotel neighborhood. There is, in fact, a police station in between and we did not feel unsafe or threatened at any time. Parking, if you have a car, is in a large, secure parking structure behind the police station - a short distance from the hotel. We would certainly stay here again if we return to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Sheepfm
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, a quiet part of macleay Street, with a bus stop to Central railway station directly outside and another bus stop to nearby Circular Quay opposite. A Woolies supermarket is also just over the road. We are a retired couple from country NSW, in Sydney for a short city escape. On our arrival we were greeted by very friendly staff who then offered us an upgrade on our standard room at no extra cost. Although small, the compact room had everything we needed, including a writing desk. The bed was firm and comfortable and there was a choice of pillows (hard/soft, fat/flat) in the cupboard if you didn't like the one provided on the bed. Bed linen, towels etc were of good quality though with no top sheet and only a doona, it was a little too warm for a mid-summer's night in Sydney. The window could be opened a short way for fresh air if one didn't want the air conditioner. The lift was a little dodgy so beware when getting in/out as the door closes very fast! When we asked at the reception desk when we were leaving, if we could leave our luggage at the hotel (check out time was 10:30am and our train didn't leave until late afternoon), the staff on the desk were most obliging - again, no extra cost.

Reviews.Title: “7 holes in my bath towel”
Reviews.Author: jenine_12
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a single room with bath and shower in november 2011 for $170 a night. To my dismay after showering I discovered there were 7 x1-2 cm holes in the bath towel. Also a few mm holes in the sheet. When I complained to the manager he said to ask for a new towel . I wrote a letter of complaint but received no reply

Reviews.Title: “Pay more to not stay in the single rooms....”
Reviews.Author: PaulSurrey1
Reviews.Content: Devere Hotel Considering the price I paid, I didn't get a lot for my money. It was over new year I stayed and the price quadrupled. I paid Â£250 a night for 3 of the nights for a single room (single bed) with a shower and toilet. There was a small fridge but this meant there was no space for draws. I had a wardrobe and that was it. So my cloths were on the small unit above the fridge the entire time.Â  I paid more to be on the quiet side, overlooking Elizabeth Bay (just) and had a peaceful nights sleep. Although housekeeping started hoovering in the corridor by 8am and unless the Do Not Disturb sign is on the door, expect a knock by half 8!Â  TV was pointless as flat to the wall, 7 foot high and pointing up and out the window. So couldn't watch unless standing on my (single) bed.Â  Air con worked fine although the room across from me had to have theirs replaced & maintenance was banging around from 8.30am.Â  It's 5 mins walk from Kings Cross which is where all the bars and clubs are. But more importantly where the train station is. This area is perfectly safe during the day despite all the rumours. There's a few odd characters about but you get that in every city. At night it comes alive and you get drunk people. But nothing you wouldn't get in London or New York.Â  You don't get a safe in your room but a box is available (free) at reception.Â  Internet is expensive (like everything in Sydney!!!) 4 bucks an hour.Â  You can walk to Sydney Opera House in 20 mins or Curcular Quay in 25 mins. It's a long walk up hill the last 10 mins on the way back though. Although the 311 bus does go and stop right outside the hotel for Circular Quay. Not very frequent though & ignore the timetable.Â  If you're on a budget and get it for less than Â£50 a night then it's worth it. Else don't bother with these rooms as not enough room to swing a cat (and I mean that literally!).Â

Reviews.Title: “New Years Eve Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: RM B
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked this hotel for a week over New Years Eve. It was one of the only hotels we could find as we booked 3 months in advance. Staying here was a mistake. It was the most expensive hotel of our trip due to the time of the year, and it was a dump. Firstly, we found a live cockroach in our room that I killed. As I was leaving my room the next morning I informed the night manager that the cockroach was there, and that not only did it need to be removed, but we needed to discuss this issue. When we returned from our day activities, it was still there!!! Then, there was the day that they didn't give us clean bath towels, and when I asked for towels I was told the hotel ran out. What type of hotel runs out of towels? When I asked the manager about towels, he told me if I expected better service I should have stayed a better hotel. So, I'm passing along his advice. Stay at a better hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate but expensive”
Reviews.Author: Mr_MrsB_12
Reviews.Content: Not our favourite hotel on our 5 week Australian trip, but adequate. Although we used tripadvisor to find the best deal on-line it was the most expensive, and not the best hotel we stayed at. We heard cheaper rates being quoted on the phone by reception staff. However, Potts Point is a very attractive area with good restaurants, cafes for breakfast and with a reasonable bus service to the City centre. It took us 45 minutes to walk to the Opera House past Wooloomooroo and through the Botanic Gardens which is very pleasant. Room was basic, small with a tiny window overlooking the adjacent property.

Reviews.Title: “Good n tidy”
Reviews.Author: arashPerth
Reviews.Content: A little bit expensive might because of the Xmas period but very good location,tidy, and double bedroom

Reviews.Title: “Cheap Room Rate, Kitchen in Room, Bed Bugs, Near Nightlife Area, Convenient”
Reviews.Author: jackykk
Reviews.Content: Lowest room rate on average among other 3 stars hotels in Sydney; basic kitchen included in the guest room, so one can buy food from supermarket and cook in the room; friendly and helpful staff; however, could not sleep well due to bed bugs; many pubs and discos in walking distance along Macleay Street; just opposite to Woolworths where one can almost fulfill the daily needs.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl M
Reviews.Content: This was are first visit to Sydney so I wasn't sure where to stay. After traveling around the city I was very happy with our choice. The Devere Hotel was a couple of blocks from the "Crossing", steps away from a grocery store, pizza shop, pharmacy, bottle and beer shops and a 5 minute walk to Elizabeth Bay. Be sure to confirm your reservation with the DeVere as they somehow did not receive our reservation from Expedia. After returning home, Expedia confirmed that it was sent to the hotel. So with that, our first room was very tiny and had no kitchen and we were not very happy. The next day they had a room opening and we were able to move to a larger room with a kitchen and balcony. The rooms are nothing to write home about but you are not in them much so it wasn't a big deal. Our room was always clean and serviced with fresh towels when we arrived back later in the day. The front desk was awesome in helping us set up tours, giving directions, etc. Two thumbs up to them! I would strongly recommend the Muliti-pass for the week. It will get you on all public transportation - ferries, train, buses, and rail. There is so much to see and do. Here are just some ideas - pack a lunch and have a picnic in the Bitanical Gardens (beautiful place), take a tour to the Blue Mountains (awesome), spend a day at Bondi or Manly beach, cross the Sydney Harbour bridge on foot, don't miss the Sydney Seafood warf if you love seafood, take a long ferry ride down the river and see the home of the 2000 Sydney Olympic games.....I can go on. You won't be bored but bring lots of spending money - this place is not cheap. Beer recommendations - VB or Pure Blonde. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel, return visit”
Reviews.Author: shed_gal
Reviews.Content: This is my 4 or 5th return to the Devere and is the hotel I stick to when I am on a tight budget (superior twin). We often visit Sydney and Kings Cross is always my choice of area to stay. I wouldn't say it was seedy, more interesting, and you are normally safe in the Cross and the hookers never bother you. Yes it is basic but I always find it clean and comfortable. We had a room overlooking the harbour this time and was perfectly adequate for our 3 night stay. I always find the staff pleasant and they booked our return shuttle as requested. This isn't the best hotel in the Cross (try the Holiday Inn or Diamante) but it does everything it says it will do. Clean, cheap accomodation in a central location if you like the Cross as much as we do. I have stayed in some dumps before (read my other reviews) and this is definetly not one of them. As to the noise factor from the renovations, ask for a harbour room view, we didn't hear a thing.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for a budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Adrian53
Reviews.Content: The Devere Hotel is well located in the Kings Cross area of Sydney. I stayed there for 2 weeks in one of the studio/family rooms with kitchenette. I would say this hotel was acceptable if you are on a budget but I would not go much further than that. The facilities in my room were ok but not great. The windows were awful - sliding glass windows that nearly fell out of their frame at each movement, and many of the panes were cracked. The fittings and furniture were basic, functional enough. Kitchenette had a kettle toaster and microwave, plus heating hotplate and sink and cutlery and crockey, so basic food preparation was possible. TV was poor, but badly positioned though, and I had to change my initial room because the first room TV did not work, although the staff were very friendly and happy to change my room. Actually the service from the staff was friendly and good at all times. The room was noisy because it was located by a street that had a lot of party noise, traffic noise and refuse trucks emptied rubbish bins very early and very noisily. But if you choose a location like Kings Cross, I think noise is to be expected. The room I had was very large, although not well lit, and the first room (that I moved from) had very poor windows for the kitchen and bathroom, as they just opened into a bleak lightwell with no daylight. I was glad to leave that room behind. The rooms was cleaned regularly though and things were left for me neatly every day. I had no other issues, so as a basic hotel I would say this served my needs

Reviews.Title: “Great for its price”
Reviews.Author: arutea
Reviews.Content: If you book early enough, this probably ends up being one of the cheapest hotels in Sydney (aside from back-packer share room style accommodation.) It was very small but clean and just right. I wouldn't recommend it to anyone who needs a lot of room but I've stayed here twice, once by myself and once with a partner. It was just right for the one night. It is in Potts Point so not the best neighbourhood but it's further down the street from the heart of the crazy night life and it's a very secure building. Great for someone just looking for a place to stay the night. I was woken up by loud construction work at precisely 9AM though... that's my only complain and hopefully it's not permanent because I would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Noisey building work in the hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SmkLondon
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last week and checked out asap. There was noisey building work being carried out in the Indian restaurant in their ground floor that started at 7am each morning!!! I arrived after a 24hr flight at 6am only to be woken up straight away, the same the next day. I checked out immediately. I can't believe they let them start that early and don't have any obligation to alert guests when making a booking tht this is the case. Awful. There are much nicer guests houses nearby such as Victoria Court.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for...usually...”
Reviews.Author: MnJV
Reviews.Content: My business associates and I were in Sydney and stayed over one night on personal time to "see" the city. Rather than staying at the Hilton (we were there on per diem), we decided to save some money and book a less expensive place for our personal night - and...the old adage that "you get what you pay for" is absolutely true. The good news: 1 - Price is right - abuot $117US, and everything is expensive in AUS (coffee is $4-$5, coke was $4.75, pack of gum was $4, etc.) 2 - Within reasonable walking distance to the huge park & ANZAC memorial (maybe 1/2 - 1 mile). That may seem far to some, but trust me, the park is worth walking through anyway, so might as well strap on your walking shoes and go from the hotel! The bad news: 1 - The hotel is in the "red light" district, so unless that's what you're looking for, it's really uncomfortable. Hookers everywhere... 2 - The room was T-I-N-Y...turning around in the room was literally challenging with roller luggage. 3 - Both my and my associates rooms weren't clean (short curlies on the tile floor in the bathroom, goodness only know in the carpeted area...ug!) 4 - Never did find and A/C - it was hot 5 - Lobby looked like something out of a bad 80's Asian movie 6 - "Help" staff was...not so much. For example, we asked for a taxi and were curtly told we could hail one ourselves (which, as it turns out, was really easy). Maybe it was all in the delivery but even if someone can't help you, attitude is everything. 7 - The walls are...paper thin. You can hear everything in the hall and in the adjacent rooms...did I mention the hotel is in the red light district? Um...yea... There's more, but you get the idea. At the end of the day, my associate and I survived, but I would NEVER take my family here. As expensive as it might otherwise be, I'd suck it up and spend the money on a nice, known-quantity hotel in city center.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel if as long as you avoid room 126 and other rooms facing Macleay St.”
Reviews.Author: Jamesfarnarkler
Reviews.Content: The location is great and the hotel is great too however I must warn you about room 126. The room itself is very nice. A double bed and a single with a nice cosy bathroom. The problem is that it needs soundproof windows. As the street the hotel is on the street which runs right through the heart of Kings Cross, you get every hoon on a Harley or WRX charging up and down all night. Unless you have hearing problems, or can sleep through artillery fire, I recommend you ask for a room which doesn't front on to the street.

Reviews.Title: “A nice stay”
Reviews.Author: knog
Reviews.Content: This place is in Potts Point so a bit of a walk to the main areas but perfectly doable. We were initially given a room right next to the lift shaft and at 6.30am, people started to use the lift and it was unbelievably noisy! We complained and asked to be moved and we were given another, much better room. The rest of our stay was very nice. The place is clean and the rooms have good facilities with a small kitchen area and ensuite bathroom. Our TV however had poor digital reception but we weren't too bothered about watching TV anyway. I thought it was good value at $78 a night given that we had spent that much on hostels with no ensuite in other places.

Reviews.Title: “great on a budget!”
Reviews.Author: NURMALA
Reviews.Content: stayed for a week, had the family studio with kitchenette on the 3/4th? floor facing elizabeth bay. finding our room was like alice in wonderland. if it weren't for the huge tree obstructing our view of the way-would have been perfect. the hotel should get fly screens on windows coz its hard to get the pesky flies out. the hotel looks very tired art deco-ish from the outside & foyer but check-in was a breeze. only $20 bond for the whole stay which you get back. pity no wifi for all rooms. there might be 2 lifts but you do have to mind the mini stairs to get to your rooms. best to travel light if you hate stairs. our rooms look very '80's but comfy. sheets cleaned daily. main switch to main light, tv, ac by bedside. tv might be lcd? but could hardly watch much when we were back in our rooms. kitchen equipt with mini fridge, microwave, electric pan, eating essentials, coffee&tea. bathroom had toilettries, cheap toilet paper (bought own), plenty of towels (replaced daily), hair dryer, electric shaver. one thing that was a bit annoying was getting hot water. had to turn the hot water tap to the max and turn on a bit of the cold to really shower or else had to wait 15 minutes to get anything (that was when we arrived). rooms are made daily so best to be out before midday. bus stop in front of hotel big bonus. hotel is on the quieter part of kings cross/potts points. area ecclectic mix of victorian, art deco, 70's, modern mix of archiecture. has some sofistication compared to 5 minutes up the roam to the king's cross station (red light district). thank god didn't bring my son here. another bonus is woolworths that closes midnight daily 50 metres opposite the hotel. takes around 5-10 minute walk to elizabeth bay, 30 minutes is you follow the pathway through the royal botanical gardens to circular quay/cbd. taxi ride from darling harbour -$20ish, from circular quay $15ish. best to buy a mymulti rider if thinking of commuting to see sydney attractions. saves money. front desk/staff all very friendly, helpful. happy to help you sort out tours, even 10pm at night. there are laundry facilities on level 4. eat out so never tried the breakfast buffet. if you're on a budget, this is a great place to stay for a good night sleep. one of the reason's why we stayed here is bcoz due to past reviews. also coz it was last minute, all the backpackers that did have an ensuite were fully booked. i hate sharing bathrooms. they never keep it neat or clean.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Wayfarer56
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Devere in September 2011, and found the staff to be very helpful and accommodating. The room was clean, adequately large and comfortable. The hotel is close to the waterfront (5 minutes walk) which allows you to walk and see Sydney via the excellent pathway running along the water. The guest were an interesting mix of travelling youth and retirees. The hotel breakfast was both excellent and a great value. I would happily stay at this hotel again, even if I am on an expense account. Kudos to the young staff for great service.

Reviews.Title: “A bargain in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Rednecktraveller
Reviews.Content: This older hotel advertises itself as a "boutique hotel"--to me that description underrates this property as it usually means no elevator and shared bathrooms, while the DeVere has an elevator and all rooms have individual bathrooms. It is definitely an older but well-maintained property in a quiet suburb adjacent to the bars and restaurants of Kings Cross with easy bus(right outside the door ) and rail ( a five minute walk) access to public transportation. The staff is extremely helpful and necessary repairs to my room were made promptly. My room was large and clean and the balcony overlooking Macleay St was a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Clean,quiet & great value.”
Reviews.Author: pinkflamingo88
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the refurbished 'internet' rooms on 1st floor. Amazingly quiet for a place so close to the Cross, friendly efficient service. Room a little on the small side & not much of an outlook, but clean & nicely furnished. Great to see a hotel providing free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “It's clean and affordable”
Reviews.Author: Burmo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night due to price and location - walking distance to a large number of good bars and restaurant. The hotel has a large reception area who were efficient and friendly. The room we had (family) was pretty good with small kitchenette, double bed and bathroom. Would usually be a quiet room as it faced a side street but we had some minor construction happening on Sunday morning. Would stay again for a short stint. Parking is available but is $25 on top of your room rate and a decent walk away, so be mindful if you're carrying a lot of luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and affordable(For Australia)”
Reviews.Author: oxjohnnysangelxo
Reviews.Content: -Free wifi although its just for one device and the rate for an additional is too high. -The Indian Restaurant that was downstairs has since closed. -Room was large and comfortable. -Two full length mirrors which for some reason I've noticed is rare in hotels especially in Australia. - Potts Point is great neighborhood. You can walk down to the Kings Cross train station which is about 10 minutes or take Bus # 311 which has a stop right in front of the hotel. It's also across the street from a Woolworths so you can purchase snacks and drinks and put them in the mini fridge. Con: Rates double on the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: JohannPollard
Reviews.Content: Well, it was cheap accommodation for 2 nights in Sydney. Room smelt a bit manky, but the linen was clean and the tv worked. The elevator makes one hell of a racket going up and down.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: emmalej
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location. Not right in the opera house but you can get there walking or taking the bus. (25 min walking to the Botanic Garden app). You can walk to Kingcross station, the bus stop is at the door of the hotel and the hop-on-hop-off bus has a stop in front of the hotel too. There is a supermarket in front of the hotel and lots of nice restaurants are nearby. The organic markets are there every sunday just a block from the hotel..check it online if you are interested on it..case I'm not sure if this have changed now. You can get a room with a view to the opera house and the Sydney harbour bridge! but be careful because the one that we had was near the elevator and was quiet noisy at night. The main entry got stairs and to get to most of the rooms you need to take the stairs or a very small elevator, so not sure if a person with disability can move comfortability around in this hotel. The bed and toilet need an upgrade but everything was clean. Not beautiful but clean. Coffee and tea facilities and small fridge were included in our room. Breakfast was cheap (does not include fresh fruits) but milk, eggs, sausages, and so on..it was okay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: quaeri
Reviews.Content: Ideal hotel to stay in sydney. The location is great: there are many nearby shops, restaurants and supermarkets opened until midnight! About 200 m you can take a bus to visit the city, it will take in front of the most important museum and place of Sydney. the hotel offers very large rooms and clean. The service is ok. The reception is kind.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and convenient”
Reviews.Author: cousins10
Reviews.Content: The location is really great, easy walking distance to King's Cross Railway Station. busstop at hotel door and hop-on-hop-off bus passes in front of hotel.The staff were courteous making the check-in/check-out process very easy. All our enquiries and requests were dealt with in a friendly manner. The room small without being crowded. It was clean, beds were comfortable, shower is over bath but water was lovely and hot. The breakfast was sufficient but not extravagant (we paid half price for breakfast because of early booking. If we'd had to pay full price we'd have eaten at one of the many placed along the street nearby) The "kitchenette in the room was all but useless having only a bar fridge and sink. A small microwave would have helped to make more useful. The one negative point for us were the stairs down into the hotel reception area and again up to the lift. I was not expecting the stairs and though they were not many for some they would be a definite obstacle. They were for me. Overall, we think we got as much as we paid for. The location, style and facilities suited our holiday purpose and we would definitely consider staying there again on a future trip to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “A very good accomodation”
Reviews.Author: covey28
Reviews.Content: I didn't know what to expect before arriving, but it was the first and the best accomodation I had in Sydney : not to pricey but a big room with a view. An elevator, efficient staff, good location. The bathroom was clean, the kitchenette was ok. Not noisy. The hotel, the rooms seem old but everything is clean and safe.

Reviews.Title: “Great value despite pokey room”
Reviews.Author: Victorianlad
Reviews.Content: I paid A$84.85 for a single room with views through www.needitnow.com.au including $4.85 booking fee. Check-in was fast. The lift quickly transported me two floors. My pokey single room had a view of Sydney harbour and had been renovated in the last five years from the look of the fittings. There was no room for a chair, but teh bedroom had a fairly comfortable single bed plus a good size wardrobe, a decently sized bar fridge and a couple of other cupboards. Tea and coffee were supplied but there were only two thimbles of milk. The room was well lit with a bedside lamp. Curtains effectively blocked the light from outside. The bathroom had a hip bath with a shower overhead. Hot water was vrtually instantaneous and reliable. The toiletries were surprisingly good. Everything was clean and there was little iof any noise from outside: I suspect that the internal walls are quite thick. Checkout was also painless. Overall I found it hard to fault this hotel, the only downside being snacking on a bed when a chair would have been much more pleasant. However, if you cannot swing a cat, you cannot twirl a chair.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the thick of the action, but still nice and quiet!”
Reviews.Author: Fiver75
Reviews.Content: The Devere Hotel is very well located in Potts Point. It is literally just up the road from the infamous â€œKings Cross Stripâ€� with all its associated craziness and colour. There is a supermarket across the street and more shops, cafes and restaurants within short walking distance than you can poke a stick at! The hotel has a large lobby area, and staff who are efficient and friendly. My room was reasonable, while showing signs of wear and tear. Overall, quite clean and comfortable. Decent sized room with a small kitchenette, wardrobe and a small but efficiently designed bathroom. An empty fridge lets you fill up with your choice of goods from the supermarket across the road, and there is a decent set of glasses and cups. The area can be quite â€œcolourfulâ€� at night, but guests are protected from the goings-on outside by a security door that is locked overnight â€“ guestâ€™s room keys get them in so no need to wait for staff. CCTV adds another level of protection. Having said that, the Devere is a few hundred metres up from the bars and clubs, but I did not see any undesirables hanging around near the hotel. WIFI is available in the lobby at the cheap price of $2 per half hour, or apparently in some of the newer rooms â€“ ask for this if you want it when you book. The Devere is a great little hotel and my stay there was very comfortable. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: oxymoron2010
Reviews.Content: This is a good value for money hotel. The location of the hotel is also quite nice. The staff were friendly and helpful, the room was clean and properly serviced each day. The bathroom was also well furnished. The buffet breakfast in the morning was also quite reasonable. If the price is right I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Needs updating but could be worse”
Reviews.Author: dancingqueenuk
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a good location, and big rooms but it is dated and needs improving. The rooms are old and tired, with chipped furniture, and scratched mirrors etc. Our room had a extra area with a fridge and kettle etc which was nice. It also had a bath too.

Reviews.Title: “DISGUSTING”
Reviews.Author: lisamaryv
Reviews.Content: I made a booking for two nights. When I arrived the staff were rude and unfriendly on check in. This is an older style hotel so if you do stay here pack light as there are a lot of stairs on entering and no one to help with your bags. The lift is slow and noisy. The rooms are dirty and the bathrooms a disgrace. I had the do not disturb sign on my door and twice staff entered my room (without knocking) and with no purpose. This makes me concerned for safety of property in the hotel rooms as there is no safe in the room. I was kept up all night by the noise of the lift and from the banging doors of nearby hotel rooms. It was such a disgraceful hotel that I checked out after one night and forfeited the cost of the second night. I would strongly advise anyone thinking of staying here to think again!!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money. I stay there monthly.”
Reviews.Author: Awesome_MacAwesome
Reviews.Content: I stay at devere three days each month when I am in Sydney on business. I find it clean, simple, in a great location and value for money. It could possibly do with a facelift but then the prices would increase...you do get what you pay for. I really like the bay view rooms. Lovely view of the harbour and heads for a budget price. Highly recommended. Potts point is a wondeful, atmospheric eclectic area. One of the most wonderful suburbs. Don't be put off by other reviews...there are some cabaret shows etc but they add to the diversity. Potts is one of the great growth areas in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here unless you like second-hand smoke”
Reviews.Author: Dani_Ani
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night on a quick weekend trip to visit friends. I figured that since I would just be in my room to sleep, the quality and look of the room didn't really matter. The receptionist who initially served me was lovely, bubbly, and helpful. She took my baggage in since I couldn't check in until much later and it was ready in my room when I checked in. I had to rush off after checking in because I had a busy evening planned and I noticed the smokey smell in my room but decided that it probably wouldn't bother me. It was really strong, like someone had been smoking in my room moments earlier. I didn't realise that they actually had a smoking floor (excuse my naivety, but I didn't even realise that those existed anymore). When I got back to my room, I was too exhausted to bother reception for a room change as I checked my reservation print-out and I hadn't specifically requested a non-smoking room and I hate to be a bother. However, at 2am I woke up because the smell was so strong that I couldn't breathe properly. At that time I also realised that my airconditioner was broken. I opened the window in the bathroom to get some fresh air in but I didn't really feel safe doing that since I was practically in Kings Cross and there was no lock or flyscreen on the window. If I was staying there any longer this would have been unbearable. The tiles in the kitchenette and bathroom were old brown little tiles that I always think look dirty and the rooms are in desperate need of an upgrade. The pillows are flat but the bed was comfortable. It was only suitable to me because I was only in the room for a total of ten hours (including sleeping time) and because the location was fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel smelt stale”
Reviews.Author: thomasNottingham
Reviews.Content: The room smelt stale when we walked in. Opened windows. -smelt better but still had stale smell about the room. We were not in it much. The last night we used another pillow from the spare bed. That was when we found out where the smell was coming from. By using the pillow it seemed to let out this dreadful smell. In the end we had to put it in the kitchenette. The smell got into our lungs. I wrote a note to the Manager the following day and expected a response- but received none- so I am writing this instead.

Reviews.Title: “location location”
Reviews.Author: revreggae
Reviews.Content: Stayed there to go to the Jack Johnson concert at The Domain. Devere was one of the best priced and you can't beat the location. We just walked everywhere we went to downtown taking our time. The immediate area is lively, even on weeknights. Not many amenities at the hotel and the rooms are basic. But it's fine if you just want a place to sleep because you will be gone all day, which was the case with us.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: k_collingwood
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel from booking.com website and it looked clean and good value for money from 8/11/10 to 11/11/10 massive shock (could not wait to get out) when we arrived disgusting room did not seem clean and could do with a facelift, felt sorry for the receptionist as she tried to help with another room but the damage was done, Kev UK. PS Wish i had taken photos but could not wait to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable accommodation at a good price”
Reviews.Author: docit53
Reviews.Content: The room was very spacious and comfortable with a great view across the harbour. We only had two issues during our stay. The hair dryer was faulty and a quick phone call to reception secured a replacement immediately. The main issue was that the hot water took ages to come through, we had to run the shower for 5 minutes before we could use it. We arrived at the hotel very early, checked in and left our baggage at the reception. On returning our baggage had been taken up to our room. A substantial buffet breakfast was supplied at an excellent rate. The location was excellent, close to shops, restaurants and a bus route. We will definitely stay here again next time we visit Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal”
Reviews.Author: WhiteCamel
Reviews.Content: Have booked a single room but got upgraded to a double room, since I complained about the unpleasant smell it had...(no, I really didn't want to sleep there!). The new room was a lot better than the single one with enough space to move around. Nothing spectacular but all the rooms have minimum necessities such as a private bathroom (bath+washroom together), TV, fridge, closet, hair drier, alarm, air conditioner, electronic kettle with coffee/tea bags. *however the quality varies depend on the room. You can also pay $4/hour to use the internet at lobby (available reading+writing in Japanese!). I was lucky to have this bigger room by paying cheap, so I recommend for a short stay if you are staying in a single.

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: simcon
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is in Potts point,near city centre; with several food oulet nearby including supermarket. Bus stop are conveniently situated.. The Hotel is being refurbished' The breakfast buffet should ,however, offer more options, for after 8 days ,there is a sense of "Deja vu "

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: southcoasteagle
Reviews.Content: simply the worst hotel i have ever stayed in.room was extremely small for a 3 week stay.complained about the room which was dirty with mould in it and was not even offered another room,they also refused to give me any kind of refund,i checked out the next day anyway and stayed at the quality cambridge hotel which was superb.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: DavidandShirley
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Devere Hotel and found it to be very comfortable and clean. We had a bay view room, which was spacious. The breakfasts were great - buffet with everything from cereals to eggs, bacon, sausage, etc. The staff were helpful and friendly. The hotel is located within walking distance of Kings Cross station which was convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Not too safe an area to stay”
Reviews.Author: Harumi18
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location is not very safe. When we reached the hotel, we saw a sign instructing us what to do if we were mugged at Kings Cross. The hotel entrance is closed from 12am daily to prevent unsavoury characters from coming in. If you came back late, you had to press a bell & a hotel staff would let you in. That area was populated with "Show Girls Cabarets" & shameless women wearing almost nothing standing at the doorway trying to lure men in. Over the stay of a few days, I saw a lot of unsavoury characters hanging around the area where the hotel was located - mentally unsound people (they were shouting to themselves!), homeless men, and even a delirious drug addict! There were broken beer glass bottles littered here & there, & I even saw a used syringe! The situation is so bad there that there were no public toilets in Kings Cross (there is no public toilet even in a shopping centre!) We wanted to check out of DeVere hotel immediately the next day but as we had paid in full, we had no choice but to stay on. Fearing for our safety, we rushed to get back to the hotel everyday before it got dark, & by this, I meant 6pm Sydney time. This was no leisurely trip. We had to be on our toes at all time the few days we were at Kings Cross.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money hotel.”
Reviews.Author: trabug
Reviews.Content: Nice little boutique hotel, a bit rundown and small rooms, but clean and fine for a one night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed in 2008 & 2009 and will be staying in 2010”
Reviews.Author: Cholewinski
Reviews.Content: All the staff were very accomodating and friendly. Bus stop was right outside the hotel door, and it took 8 minutes to get to Sydney City, It was a 5 minute walk to Kings Cross Railway Station. Housekeeping cleaned the room daily. Buffet Breakfast was excellent, and the service was very friendly and professional. No request was too big. Convenience stores and restaurants were within walking distance to the hotel. Had an excellent stay, and will keep returning to this hotel each time we are in Sydney. The cost was also excellent!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and quiet hotel.”
Reviews.Author: StevenHelen
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Devere Hotel for 5 nights in March and found it perfect in every way. we got upgraded to a family room which was good. very little if no street noise. The staff were very helpful and friendly. Don't be put off by Kings Cross which is a 5 minute walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Ouuuch!!! The place where sun never shines...”
Reviews.Author: PINELights
Reviews.Content: There was a "window"-opening to a dark hole with lots of pigeon crap. Somewhat of a bomb shelter arrangement, apart from the fact that it was quite peaceful and sunny in Sydney during our stay. Basically, never again and do not get fooled with the pics, there is at least one extremely crappy room that you might end up in.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant value, great location and decent hotel.”
Reviews.Author: farnarklerCanberra
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Devere for two nights and really couldn't fault the place. The room was a good size with a decent ensuite and a nice new flatscreen tv. The staff were excellent and the location is fantastic; close enough to the station yet far enough from late night revellers. The best thing about the Devere (and I really shouldn't be letting you in on this because it'll be booked out the next time I want to stay there) is the price. A hotel room at hostel prices!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good enough for a few days”
Reviews.Author: expat4n0w
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Bay View room in the De Vere Hotel for 4 nights in December 2009. Basically, the hotel was good enough. The location is excellent - Potts Point is lovely - and it's super close to the King's Cross train station. King's Cross is a bit dodgy, with lots of underdressed underaged women and too many bars, but it's open all night and there's plenty to do. Basically the hotel was fine, although they're a bit cagey with their wireless policy. The hotel advertises wireless in every room. Not true - there's wireless in the lobby, but you have to pay extra for it. That was really our only problem with the hotel. The staff is adequate, the room we had was just fine, and we didn't get lice. Good enough, but we probably won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap looking but clean and good location”
Reviews.Author: mazivet
Reviews.Content: Stayed in an -indoor-room-,It was quiet, with a clean bathroom and Sheets. This was just what a needed. I was looking for a place to sleep and adjust to Australia time after a 15 hr flight from USA. Even that the hotel needs updates and a better Air conditioner system, it covered my needs and my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Roomy, comfey, great service”
Reviews.Author: mjurnack
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great value at less than 100$ / night. It is close enough to walk to downtown Sydney as well as the Opera House and Bridge. Our room was very roomy and quite. The staff was extremely helpful as we needed someone to confirm a tour for us while we were off on another tour. I am very pleased I chose The DeVere!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for budget family accommodation”
Reviews.Author: familyonthehop
Reviews.Content: I stayed alone with three young children (3 - 10 yo) for 5 nights. The service was excellent, the staff were friendly, helpful and knowledgable. After struggling down the short flight of stairs the first time with a stroller & our luggage, I was quickly offered assistance by the staff, then shown a ramp for future use. Thereafter, every evening when we returned from a busy day out, a ramp was waiting for us for the remaining stairs. Our room with a kitchenette was far more spacious than I expected and cleaned every day. Whilst I only requested a double & a single bed to keep costs down, I was pleasantly surprised to find an extra single had been placed in the room. This was at the expense of an eating area, but we made do with the desk. Potts Point is a beautiful area and our room faced a quiet street. Despite walking through Kings Cross several times to get to/from the train station, & passing some dodgy characters, we were only approached in an odd manner once, and the kids were mostly oblivious. And we made sure we were in by dark. I hired a car for a day and was able to park it free nearby after circling for about 10 mins, but the hotel does cater for this if you don't mind paying ($20 I think). This hotel was a bargain for our family & I intend to use it for all future visits

Reviews.Title: “1970's DÃ©cor”
Reviews.Author: Luke_48
Reviews.Content: This hotel is value for money, so donâ€™t expect a lot. The rooms are reminiscent of 1970â€™s dÃ©cor and in desperate need of updating. The air-conditioning is nothing more than a window rattler type planted into the wall. The double bed is only just a double bed â€“ a bit small! Otherwise the room is quite satisfactory and roomier than expected. Carpets appear new and the room was clean other than needing a good airing.

Reviews.Title: “alright for one night and that's it”
Reviews.Author: fsba20
Reviews.Content: we just needed one nights accomodation before heading up the coast. We didn't like this place and i wouldn't recommend it for more than a night. The reception was ok, a little tired but the room was awful - really tired and a bit grubby looking. It was not in a particulary nice area - close to Kings Cross. We had already spent a week or so in the city and stayed at the Meriton on Kent Street - a million times better!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location...don't expect a lot more.”
Reviews.Author: hanga
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the DeVere many times mover the past several years after trying various hotels in other parts of Sydney (e.g. the CBD). It is an excellent value and the location is within a 10-15 minute walk of the Domain and Botanical Garden. (Use the stairs off Victoria street for a short cut). The Kings Cross train station is just 5 minutes away. The staff is always helpful and couteous. Keep in mind that it is, at best,, a 3-star hotel. yes, the rooms are bit outdated and it is best if you request a rooom on the 3rd or 4th floor looking toward Sydney Harbor. But where else can you get a room for USD$60-$80 per night with a view of the Harbor? And how much time do you spend in the room anyway? I highly recommend the DeVere for the seasoned traveler who wants to enjoy the city and not spend a bundle.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: ChaksIndia
Reviews.Content: I was a bit apprehensive after reading a few not so favourable reviews about the hotel, but I found Devere to be good money in a city like Sydney. The location is excellent with lots of restaurants, the Kings Cross metro station and bus stand near by. Even the Bondi/Sydney Explorer bus stand is a short walk away. We found the rooms to be nice (though basic) with excellent view of the bay. We found the area to be quite safe with people walking around till quite late at night. The staff is also helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Tired hotel with rooms that need updating”
Reviews.Author: jackiemenn
Reviews.Content: Luckily we only stayed for one night - but i would have been very disappointed if I'd have stayed longer. To be fair the price was relatively cheap, and we did have a good view of the sea from the room, but the room was small and in desperate need of an update. The location wasn't the best for exploring key places on foot (we had been lucky to have stayed in a great place in Darling Harbour earlier on in our holiday and this had probably spoilt us) but there were a number of restaurants right outside the hotel on the busy street.

Reviews.Title: “Devere: location, location?”
Reviews.Author: keen-traveller04
Reviews.Content: I visited www.lastminute.com and found rates for the Devere cheaper than what they were personally offering on the website so, firstly, that's the way to go! The hotel itself was pretty good; the staff were extremely friendly, helping with bags and always ready to help us as much as the could. Room service was completed each day which was refreshing. I ordered a Deluxe Superior room and it was up to standard, although I'm not a fan of the shower/bath, as it was a very small bathtub. My only issue with the hotel, is I was led to believe off of other reviews and the hotel itself that the buffet breakfast was included with the price when actually it was $26 per person, per day. My partner and I thought that was a little excessive and walked about 30 steps to the left of the hotel and had a beautiful breakfast for $10 at the Fountain Cafe. The location is worrying if travelling with a young family, as at the end of the street is a main street of Kings Cross, and there are many eateries on the street but also many strip clubs. In fact, my partner and I were keeping count of how many prostitues we saw and for our 7 day visit, we saw 12, a few in the middle of the day. Quite shocking, really. Just keep that in mind with young ones around. The bright side of the location, is that the Kings Cross train station is just down the road and can be accessed through said street, or through the back streets opposite the hotel, which don't have any seedy clubs but is filled with many backpacking hostels. Overall, we loved our trip and being young 20 year olds, didn't mind the seediness of the street adjacent as we chose to ignore the particular lifestyle but as I said, would advise families to keep this in mind. Sydney is fantastic if you are into the hustle and bustle but also, keep away from dining in the harbour if you don't want to pay $45 for a chicken schnitzel!

Reviews.Title: “Kings Cross Scum”
Reviews.Author: DominicAuckland
Reviews.Content: It's been a couple of years since i stayed at the Devere and unfortunately my earlier good experience is a distance memory. I don't think it's been cleaned, maintained or aired since my last visit and i wouldn't stay there again. For an extra few bucks i moved to the Crown Plaza and it further highlighted just how terrible the Devere was. Be warned.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Allysotorm
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Devere for a night in December 2008. I was looking for a reasonably-priced motel close to Surry Hills, where I had an evening business function. The Devere's price of sixty or so dollars for a single room WITH a bathroom was just what I wanted. (I've stayed in an $80.00 room that was grotty, and had no bathroom.) The staffmembers were all polite and friendly. The breakfast was reasonably priced and first class. The room was clean and everything worked. There was no view from my room , but I was there on business, not for a view. (I have a view at home.) To reach my function, I had a five minute walk, and a short train ride with another short walk after that. Kings Cross is definitely on the colourful side for a country mouse like me, but at no point was I hassled by any of the locals. Maybe that's because I'm not young, or maybe because I did my usual alone-in-the-city thing and walked briskly along as if I knew where I was going.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed!”
Reviews.Author: RoxyQueensland
Reviews.Content: Well we booked through a site called 'wotif.com' that offered this hotel in a special discount. Prices were great and affordable and we were pleased with the hotel as the pictures on the website looked nice enough to stay in. Arrival - We arrived earlier than check in time so were allowed to put our luggage behind the front desk. Our first impression of the hotel was nice, a nice lobby with leather couches and internet, which was great! Yet there was no ramp so had to carry our heavy luggage down the stairs. (not good for the elderly). Then we sussed out the hotel resturant which was Indian so good for people who like indian food. But not for our liking. The only downside to that is the restuarant is not open for breakfast.. Safety & location- Faced with the decision of what to do until check in, we decided to go for a walk and sus out what was around the area and walk to the city. Walking through one main street in kings cross was scarey! Did not feel safe at all! You go up mecleay st (the st the hotel is on), and it leads into 'Darlinghurts st' through kings cross. Girls... i do not recommend walking through that street alone! We walked past atleast 7 strip clubs, 6 homeless people, druggo's, small gangs, prostitutes and groups of dirty sleezy men constantly loitering around the area! We were followed by men and yelled at by men wanting 'fun'. You either feel like you're goin to get bashed or violated! I strongly recommend getting the hop on hop off bus! It's a bus that takes you to every tourist attraction for $30 and is an easy way to the city. Walking took roughly 25 mins from the hotel. Hotel room- We were extremely un-impressed with the room we were given! It was a 'standard room' or more like a 'shoe box' room. Not recommended for anyone who is claustraphobic, as I am and had a few problems. Or anyone staying any longer than 4 nights. But we were only staying for a few nights so I survived. 1. There was one lamp that had no light bulb in it, and the other had a broken shade. 2. The room smelt like stale cigarett and had a musty smell to it, 3. the fridge was broken, when i opened it to put my drinks in it it was completely warm! Melted ice and water spilt everywhere, the little milks that they provide were warm and no doubt off! was not game to drink them. Yes there were coffee makeing facitities however check your jug as another guests jug/kettle was not working. No toaster. The bathroom was nice and clean. Small yet understandable for the size of the room. However it had a leaking pipe under the sink. Strangely there were alot of mosquitoes in the room and the window was shut so dont know where they came from. Made sleeping very uncomfortable. Yes there was an opening window, however i'd rather keep it shut with the amount of filth on the outside of the window! We wer located on the 2nd level, our view was a filty alley way with absolutely no way of seeing outside if it was sunny or what. The air conditioner was broken, only the fan part was working, wasn't any actual cold air con. As in another review i read yes it did seem like it was made in the 70's! We actually read on the tag wrapped around the cord and it had not been serviced in 3 years. The cleaning service was great. Made our beds and fresh towels every day. Bed sheets were good and not the type that make you itch. I would not recommend this hotel for anyone who has allergies or the elderly. As the hotel rooms and hallways are musty. There are no ramps for anyone in a wheel chair and the elevator was very small, old, made funny noises and felt like it was going to break down on us! Service- When we approached the service desk with a list of these problems the person working just shrugged it off and said it couldn't be helped, he could get someone to fix the problems but if they cant be fixed we pretty much just had to deal with it! I then asked if they couldn't be fixed could we be moved to another room and they said 'no it was all booked out'. Not even offering a discount for our dodge room or anything! He certainly needed to learn better people skills! We were not impressed as the fact that the fridge was broken how could we buy any sort of food or keep our drinks cold! A few hours later we returned to our room to find the fridge had been fixed but was still not that cold, and the light bulb had been replaced but not the other one. All in all i would give this hotel 2 starts not 3.5 and our room.... 1.5 stars. I tried to upload pics but it's taking too long to preview and submitt haveto refresh.

Reviews.Title: “Near the bus station”
Reviews.Author: LoriSLO
Reviews.Content: Devere hotel is situated in Potts point, just a minute walk from famous King's Cross street. Rooms are quite big, with TV (no SAT TV) who has like 7 channels. We had a small balcony, but we were lucky to have quite a nice view. The balcony was never cleaned and there were only two chairs, without a table. The bathroom was ok, with the hairdryer who burned up in two days. The room has also a small fridge with two very dirty glasses in it. The good thing is that you can use the internet in the hotel's lobby, for only 4 dollars for one hour. We only had breakfast, which was quite good, but always the same. On the hotel corridor was a really strange smell. The hotel is not good for disabled people, because on the entrance there are about 5 steps and when you go on the elevator there are some, too. The good thing is that there is a very good connection to the center of the city. Just in front of the hotel there is a bus station and the buses drives to the center every 20 -30 minutes. The Sydney and Bondi travel buses stops near by too (2 minutes away). You can also walk to the center of the city, but it takes about 20- 30 minutes to get to the Sydney tower and a little bit more to get to the Opera house. If you like to party a lot, it is very, very close to King's Cross street, with many pubs, bars, night clubs and alcohol shops. The one thing that seemed quite strange to me was, that there were several people working in the hotel that hardly speak English. Really, believe me. The final word....the hotel is not a super deluxe hotel, but it's cheep so you can not expect the luxury things...but in my opinion they could do much more on the cleaning and on personality. But after all....you only sleep in a hotel....otherwise...you spend the whole days getting around Sydney.... I survived and it was not that bad....so you will, too.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Expect Much”
Reviews.Author: VideoGamer
Reviews.Content: LOCATION: The hotel has a map that shows how to get to the key tourist desinations like the Opera House and Harbour Bridge. I guess the ones who created the map are used to walking great distances. While in print, the places seemed near, it actually took us 40 minutes to get to the primary tourist spot, the Opera House. The walk was ok, but I guess they should not put it down as though the places were just a few blocks away. SERVICE: We arrived with 2 big luggages. Before you could actually reach the front desk - you'll be faced with the Devere Puzzle. How do I bring my luggages down? The entrance is a couple of steps higher than the actual lobby, so you had to drag your luggages down, as there was an absence of ramps. After checking-in, the Puzzle continues - how do I bring up my luggages? This time around, it's the elevator that's 2 steps higher than the lobby. Who's the architect of this building? Anyway, we were trying to look for any sign from the receptionist of an alternative way or if someone will be helping us up but it seemed like it's a lost cause. The lift seemed like it was running since World War 2. It makes eerie sounds and the buttons don't even light up when you press them. ROOM: The room was ok, but had a really odd atmosphere of oldness. It had an old house smell. Near our bed, there was a creaking sound whenever we step on a particular square foot on the floor. The airconditioning unit was probably bought in the 70s, but hands down because it still performed its cooling duties well. We were still able to sleep well though.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, great location”
Reviews.Author: elliot749
Reviews.Content: This is a great little Hotel, in a great location, just down the hill from Kings Cross Station (5 minutes easy walk). My room was small, but hey,it was a single room, and with a lovely view of the harbour!! Staff were extra friendly and helpful, road/traffic noise was not an issue, and with a bus stop AT THE FRONT door, getting to/from anywhere couldn't be easier ! Will happily book and stay again, I enjoyed De Vere!! Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Would Recommend it”
Reviews.Author: TinTinTin
Reviews.Content: Booked a Family Apartment for the four of us for 4 nights. I would absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone. The room is very spacious with a little kitchentte with microwave, toaster, mini fridge and tea/coffee making facility. Room is clean and looks like it is newly refurbished. Within 2 minutes walk to King's Cross Station, and about 15 mins walk to the city center. Given the price paid, great bargain at a good location. Note: Not comparing this to a 5 star hotel. Comments based on price paid.

Reviews.Title: “good value for the price”
Reviews.Author: huckster
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the Devere for 4 nights and had booked a "superior" room...we checked in late, 9 pm and the room we got was unquestionably small...we could not both be up and moving at the same time. The next morning we complained and got a very nice large room with a kitchenette. The floor was designated as non smoking but reeked of smoke??...the front desk women were really nice and helpful. All in all great location to transportation and a really quaint area, even though part of the red light district. No complaints...

Reviews.Title: “Leave your credit card at home!”
Reviews.Author: tripSydney
Reviews.Content: Let me get straight to the core of the problem here: Booked and Paid 4 nights= $ Reserved the 5th night but cancelled reservation on 2nd day (within 72 hours as required by the hotel) = $ room rate of that night being held by the hotel even after cancellation Total $ being held: room rate of the 5th & cancelled night + security deposit $ = up until this date not yet reversed back to the guest's credit account. The guest was told it would take 5 days for this fund to be processed and cleared. The guest has already checked out of the hotel almost a week from now. The subsequent few days becomes a tug of war of words between the hotel, the guest and the bank where the guest account is. You guess it : the hotel reckons the bank is the one who should release the holding fund; The bank reckons this is a matter between the customer and the hotel and the bank has got nothing to do with this matter; The hotel simply makes up the rules as they go along as far as their terms of conditions are concerned, even to the extent that it takes 10 days for that holding fund to be released back to the guest's account! Let me tell you exactly what happened: The guest greeted by a somehow sweet looking gal who seem to know what she was doing except she did not do what is the most important thing in a hotel check in: Tell the guest the TRUTH! There was no mentioning of holding of the room rate after cancellation within the timeframe. There was no mentioning of Terms & Conditions regarding to the release or reverse of holding funds to the guest's account. The question here is : why on earth does the hotel still hold the room rate of the 5th night onto the guest's credit account when the guest has advised the hotel to cancel that night within the timeframe required in the first place? The morale of the story is : who gets the worst end of the bargain? Unfortunately as always is : the Guest! Fortunately though the hotel does have some conscience and decide to make some changes to their 'policy': $50 security deposit now has gone down to $20 If you make the payment for the duration of your stay in the form of cash that includes etpos, you will get your 'unused' room rate charge' and the security deposit when you check out NOT 5 or 10 days after. What does that mean to all the guests : Leave your credit cards at home! If this hotel does not follow the above rule then you guys should step up and do something about it just like I did. This just to prove that They Do Care after all. I was impressed with everything else but that costly mistake made the hotel leaving me almost out of pocket and struggle financially to live through that week is unthinkable. If there is any consolation at all comes out of this experience is the fact I have used this same credit card to 3 other hotels in the same state and I have no issue or problem of this kind whatsoever. Isn't this a comforting feeling!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, bay view”
Reviews.Author: Trimurty
Reviews.Content: We have chosen Hotel DeVere on the basis of the location: there are not so many accommodation opportunities at Kings Cross, especially on the New Year's Eve. And we were not disappointed at all. I asked for a bay view room on the 4th floor - and we got it upon arrival. The great advantage of the higher floor was that it was quiet at night. The hotel is located within easy walking distance (about 5 min) to the Kings Cross Train Station. And in case you like to walk - it will take you 30 min to get to Darling Harbour on foot. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We never noticed a cleaning lady, but our room was always tidy when we came back at the end of the day. The room looked a bit shabby. Bed sheets were old and one with stains, but it we did not expect Hilton for the price we paid. We liked the atmosphere of this small hotel and definitely would not hesitate to stay there again if in Sydney. I rated this hotel "above average" meaning that for it's 3-star category it was OK, and even great considering nice view and location.

Reviews.Title: “Like Swiss Cheese, tastes fantastic but contains holes.”
Reviews.Author: Mitcheh
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 3 nights at the Devere Hotel in Potts Point, Sydney. If you plan to stay there, ask for a room with water views as we were stuck on the first floor with a view and noise from renovations occurring in Crick Lane. Also ask for a non smoking area as the floor we were given reeked of smoke. Some lights didn't work and our bed linen was very thin in places and needs to be replaced. Having said all this, the staff were friendly and helpful, the breakfast buffet will keep you going all day and the location is a big plus. A bus (311) is directly outside and travels to Circular Quay wher you can access trains or ferries to all parts of Sydney for only $16 a day. We found this to be great value and used it every day we were in Sydney. I suppose I was a little disappointed with the room but overall for value I would recommend it with the above advice.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value - budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Doodstar
Reviews.Content: We found the Devere hotel to be a good budget hotel. Located within easy walking distance from Kings Cross Station. Room was a little tired - but bathroom quite good. Beds were very comfortable and the room was very quiet. It had a view of the bay area. The breakfast was very very good and we found the staff very helpful with tourist advice. All in all we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place, but not 3 stars”
Reviews.Author: johnklin
Reviews.Content: Devere is a decent hotel but I wouldn't say it is a 3 star hotel. The room I stayed in was a bit dark and had a 80s feel to the decor. Overall, the room and bathroom were clean and large enough for just myself. Location is very good. Only about a 10 minute walk or less to King's Cross subway station. Plenty of ATM's, convenience stores, post offices, internet cafes, restaurants, bars and clubs nearby, but far enough so you don't hear all the partying at night.

Reviews.Title: “Older and shows its age”
Reviews.Author: GlennandPat
Reviews.Content: The Devere Hotel is located slightly away from the seedy part of Kings Cross, just far enough away to avoid the noise. We stayed there for a total of three nights. The Devere Hotel is a good buy for Sydney and we would recommend it if you are on a tight budget. The room was clean, but very small. The bed was hard and could be difficult to get to sleep in. The TV radio and AC are controlled by a hard-to-find switch located next to the bed. The bathroom was quite nice, spacious and clean. The view from the room was a very pleasant surprise as we could see the harbour. A big plus is that the reception is open 24/7 and you an leave your key with the receptionist. The hotel is right in front of a bus stop and a 5 minute walk from the metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel - No frills but clean tidy - Noisy room due to trafic.”
Reviews.Author: Lombear
Reviews.Content: On first appearance the hotel looks quite impressive, as we knew from the start this was a budget hotel, this was not to be expected. Our room was spacious, clean and tidy, although a little dated. My one gripe is the room we were staying in was at the front of the hotel and was very noisy due to the traffic...don't forget your ear plugs! I thought I could live with it and I did but if I were staying any longer I would have had to move rooms. The location of the hotel is okay, it is about a 20 minute walk to the city or you could walk to Kings Cross Station and get the train which is what we did a number of times. Be warned though some may find it uncomfortable with the short walk to the station due to it being the red light district and having to walk past a number of unsavoury characters. The hotel is more towards Potts Point and there are quite a few nice restaurants around the corner. Apart from the noise which aggravated me the rooms were cleaned daily and to a good standard. The staff were friendly and very helpful. Would I stay again? Possibly, for the price I paid I thought it was okay however I would first look at other hotels closer to the center of Sydney. I would recommend this to people on a budget but ensure you do not get a room at the front o f the building.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting hotel...Avoid like the plague”
Reviews.Author: thechef65
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for a stay in mid March. Lobby looked dirty upon arrival however we proceeded to check in. Once we got to the room it was even worse. The bed had to have been at least twenty years old. The walls were peeling as was the ceiling. It was clear that the room wasnt properly upkept by the stained carpeting, permanent black dirt on the window sills. The door did not open without scraping the floor and making a loud noise. The worst however were the several stains on the bedding and shower curtain. The shower curtain stains were so plentiful that it looked like a design. The bedding was full of food stains as though someone was eating chili and spilled it in at least five places. We were so disgusted we took pictures of the filth to make sure we were refunded. We checked out almost immediately and the hotels manager stated he would refund all but our first night eventhough we were not staying there. After this disaster we decided to spend the extra money and stayed at one of the botique hotels in the rocks which was very nice. Very unfortunate that we had to proceed to get out money back by other means. I cant believe anyone would be satisfied by the condition of this hotel. It is right around the corner from Kings Cross and the metro there, however if forced I would stay at one of the hostels in Kings Cross over this Devere.

Reviews.Title: “Very attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: AndrewandJenny
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at the DeVere in January 2007 and from the moment we arrived the staff could not have been more helpful. They would not accept a tip for carrying our luggage to our rooms on our arrival, and were attentive, helpful and friendly at all times. The hotel was very affordable, and excellent for people on a tight budget. The rooms were very comfortable; they were always clean, and equipped with kettle, tea and coffee and toiletries. Some of the rooms (we changed half way through our trip due to going to another location for two days) had a microwave, kitchenette, iron and ironing board. The breakfast was more than adequate. The location was good - near to Woollomooloo and King's Cross, and half an hour's walk from Circular Quay and the Opera House; and there are lots of cafes and restaurants nearby. The 311 bus stops just outside the hotel. There is a bank and post office minutes away, and Woolworths is just across the road. There are some lovely views of Elizabeth Bay from the 3rd and 4th floor rooms, and check out the view from the Ladies on the 5th floor!

Reviews.Title: “Devere Hotel - Fantastic Value”
Reviews.Author: Casey80
Reviews.Content: i stayed at this hotel for 2 nights and had no regrets at all.
