Before booking my accommodation I read some of the reviews and had my reservations but upon checking into the room I could not understand what hotel everyone else was staying at and how they could give it such bad reviews. The Devere was a fantastic place to stay for the price. The rooms were clean and served their purpose. It was just down the road from the busy section of the cross with shops and transport in very close vicinity. Hotel staff was friendly and helpful. My only criticism was that the bathroom was fairly small and the walls were not exactly sound proof but that wasn't a huge problem. The price was fantastic! With 2 of us staying in the room it was maybe only $5 more than a backpackerâ€™s hostel except we had a private room and bathroom. I would recommend it to anyone who wants a convenient and clean place to stay with the intention of seeing Sydney during the day and crashing late at night in a comfortable room. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with this Budget Accomodation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After much consideration (I spent almost 3 weeks searching the net for a deal) we decided to stay at the De vere. Our Travel agent tried to talk us out of it saying it was a horrible place - which we found far from the truth. Price Range - In regards to previous comments about it being over priced for what it was. Id love someone to show me a hotel with the same amemities that was cheaper and located in the city suburbs. We orginally considered seeking a private room at backpacker accomoation but found that it was more than this hotel per night. Other places, you paid the same but had to share a bathroom. I found the De vere great for the price. We got the room at about 89 Australian dollars a night - off peak. Hotel decoration - The decor was middle of the range. There were no extreme marks on the walls or carpet etc. It is not the slum some people have made it out to be. We did find that you could hear abit of noise from he hallway (if your neighbours were inconsiderate) and there were places through the builing were the floor was a tad uneven. Transport - We found public transport there great. The Kings cross train station is only 5 to ten minutes walk. Its only 3 (small) blocks away. Trains run every 5 minutes and go from 4:30am - 2am every day so I have no idea how the previous person had issues getting back at night. I highly recommend for anyone travelling the sydney to use the train system. It is cheap and efficent. Once you have used it once you are home free The Bus stop to Cirrcular quay is only a directly across the road from the hotel. The bus dosent come as often and dosent run as late at night but is great if you cant be bothered walking to the station. Saftey - The hotel is great. There is someone on reception at all hours and they will open the door for you at all hours. This stops any undesirable people coming in. I would warn people traveling through kings cross, be carefull with your bags as they sometimes have pick pockets etc. The hotel itself is on the cusp of Kings Cross and Potts Point. Potts point is a posh area and i guess you all know that Kings cross is the red light district and a very popular tourist area. Breakfast - We didnt really enjoy breakfast there. We found better deals when walking down to Kings cross and there is a woolworths supermarket across the road. Service - We found the staff really helpfull and friendly. I was constantly asking questions on how to get here and there and they told us the easiest ways etc. We were also put on a roadside room, which was very spacious. We stayed in the room for 3 nights but found that we were getting disturbed by the traffic noise (Sydneysiders love to beep thier horns at all hours of the night). The staff were more that happy to relocate us to a smaller but quieter room on the other side of the building which had a habour view. Comfort - We found the beds comfortable and everything clean and tidy. We had all of hour bedding changed each day and fresh towels like expected. We had no problems. All in all we enjoyed our stay. This is a middle of the range hotel, if you are use to being waited on hand and foot - then it wont be your thing. For the budget traveler who dosent expect much this is a great deal for your money. We would go again.

Reviews.Title: “For Seasoned Travelers”
Reviews.Author: Zoom_Gotti
Reviews.Content: I travel quite a bit and stay in the full range of hotel types. The DeVere is an older, few frills hotel on a busy corner in Potts Point. True, Darlinghurst Road between MacLeay and Victoria is the lively 24-hr all night entertainment district and sits only about 3 blocks away, but I wouldn't let that discourage you from staying there. Remember, the hotel charges lower rates because it's an older building, with dated furnishings, and many of the rooms are non-standard sizes. If I were you, I would inspect the room first and try to secure a deal with a buffet breakfast included. The reception is friendly and probably will work to accommodate you, if possible. But what I like about Potts Point and The Cross is the location! This is the "hip" area of Sydney. Lots of cafes, diverse restaurants, and public transportation choices. The 311 bus stops at the door. City Rail is a 5-minute walk. Buses to Bondi, Double Bay, and Watson's Bay stop close by. Walk to Rushcutter's. Don't complain - get out and do something!

Reviews.Title: “Booked in, Then checked out!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kevin&JenAhern
Reviews.Content: Booked to stay in the Devere for xmas 2003 because of the great offer of book 4 days get 5th FREE! Firstly the hotel is in the Red light district, which I thought would be OK as we planned to be out and about, but it is quite intimidating. Even more intimidating when you have a suitcase and Didgeridoo (Spot the tourist)!!! We arrived at the Devere and staff were friendly enough to be fair but the room was not good! As a guy I could have managed a night there (we booked for two weeks) but my fiancee was not prepared to stay at all because of the poor standards so we cancelled our booking and left straight away. The staff were good to be honest and cancelled our booking without any problems. Not clean, dated, dark corridors, tiny lift, Very Poor!

Reviews.Title: “bit grubby”
Reviews.Author: bananabook
Reviews.Content: We booked from the UK and stayed for 3 nights. I expected basic for the price, but was rather disappointed overall - have stayed in better for much less. In comparison to the rate we got for our other 3 nights in Sydney at the Intercontinental, the De Vere wasn't actually that cheap! - for not that much more we had luxury and location at the Intercon. I found the hotel to be a bit dark and grubby, with shabby corridors and a tiny room with a bed to match! The bedding had holes in it and had seen better days, room was very dated and the net curtains were dirty. The bathroom although clean was tiny and my 6 ft 3 husband had a few problems - a rather dangerous, unmarked 'step' to the bathroom was the cause of a couple of bruised toes before we put a beach towel down to level floor. The desk were pleasant but did not put themselves out for you particularly - they were indifferent towards us and the hotel lacks personality. The area / location is great though and has plenty to make up for it! Thankfully, we only needed a bed from 'late to early' to rest after a days crammed sightseeing in Sydney - just as well as we weren't in a hurry to rush back to the hotel for any cosy newly-weds nights! De Vere was our first Honeymoon stop after an amazing wedding at Kewarra Beach resort Nth Queensland, so maybe we had gotten too used to the luxury and pampering we had experienced there?

Reviews.Title: “Pot Luck”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at DeVere August 2004. Our first impressions were not good. Had to wait until after midday to have room available but I have to say after we had stayed 4 nights we found some positives. The inclusive breakfast was very good and there was plenty of variety in the breakfast offerings. The hotel is tired and needs considerable re-fubishment but our room was clean and we had lovely views(harbour) Our friends room was not as good and was considerably smaller. It seems a bit "pot luck" as to what you get. The price is excellent though. Lots of food outlets in the area and a 100 yards to Kings Cross.The hotel is very well served by bus and train transport. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Room wasn't that great. Agree with the comment on smell. Bathroom was better than some hotels I stayed at. About 10 min. walk from Kings Cross Station. A bit problematic getting back if stay in the city past midnight. Cab's the only way (besides walking) and it costs ~$1 a block.

Reviews.Title: “Not a hotel i would recommend”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the DeVere hotel in May 2003, we were far from impressed. The rooms were outdated and in need of refurbishment. The walls were paper-thin and there was a strong smell of mildew. To top this off, in the corner of the kitchenette was a plastic container with moldy strawberrys! But i have to give credit to the staff who were extremely friendly and helpful. The reason i gave this review is to let other people know about this hotel. We read a good review and were very disapointed.

HotelInfo.Name: DeVere Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 44 - 46 Macleay Street | Potts Point, Sydney, New South Wales 2011, Australia
